metadata.title: CVE-2019-11759 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An attacker could have caused 4 bytes of HMAC output to be written past the end of a buffer stored on the stack. This could be used by an attacker to execute arbitrary code or more likely lead to a crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 70, Thunderbird < 68.2, and Firefox ESR < 68.2.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1').
